Posts.Content: May 6, 2011 05:23AM gramma23 wrote: Thank you Linda Lou for the pictures. I am coming up on 3 years post surgery and I am not dealing with the swelling. I was told if I did not get it right after chemo I would not get it but now I have. I am supposed to go to a doctor for this. I think I might have lifted something too heavy ( a granddaughter) Anyway your pics are just like mine. some days are worse than others. I already wear compression stockings so I think I need a body compression suit. My grandson suggested this! I also have had too much salt lately so I wonder if this was why it showed upo all of a sudden? I do drink a lot of water. I still have blood problems, low hemoglobin mostly but I take Procrit shots and I do worry about blood clots from that. Carolyn
Posts.Title: VISIBLE SIGNS OF LYMPHEDEMA - A PICTORIAL LindaLou53 glennie19

Posts.Content: May 10, 2011 05:10AM gramma23 wrote: My doc has not called me about the appointment yet so I will call them to see. They are so busy it may be buried under a stack of stuff. My aunt had it after breast cancer and she had double mast. but only had lympedema on one side. She always wrapped her arm but I am wondering about Keneseosis. I am not sure how to spell that but I know that she did that towards the end of her life. I am going to find out about that if I can. Carolyn
Posts.Title: VISIBLE SIGNS OF LYMPHEDEMA - A PICTORIAL LindaLou53 glennie19

Posts.Content: May 15, 2008 06:02AM gramma23 wrote: I too have just found out I have breast cancer. I found a lump just after Christmas and thought it was the fibrocystic lumps I have had before but then this one felt different. I did not run to the doctor because the last one I did and they did not even see it on the mamogram or ultra sound. They said it was just some thick mucus membrane. I have fibromyalgia and so I figured this was making sense. My arm pit started swelling one night after I had taken care of a baby and holding and playing with him made it sore so I knew that was different. I am almost 61 years old and should know better! anyway they have done a needle biopsy and I am due for an MRI next Friday 23rd. I don't dread that but I am ready to get on with the treatment but I have not told my children yet. I am waiting until I know something from the MRI and getting graduation over too. My youngest son was getting his BS degree and one of my grandsons is graduationg from a Tech school and also High School I don't want to spoil that time for them. If I was just not doing anything about it right now i would be worried but I am doing what the doc tells me so I leave the rest in God's hands. I guess I came here just to be able to say it to someone other than my husband. My fear is the kids finding out and knowing I have not told them yet.
Posts.Title: just found out! tammyj38 Kerry71

Posts.Content: May 16, 2008 04:32AM gramma23 wrote: Thanks for the encouragement. I know I will fight and I am a strong old lady. I just hope all that is just diag will feel the same. I do feel bad for those with small children. I can imagine how scary that can be. I have children and grandchildren that I need to be around for also. gramma23
Posts.Title: just found out! tammyj38 Kerry71

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2008 06:30AM gramma23 wrote: I am supposed to start radiation but they keep moving my appointments with it being the holidays I guess.the doc said to get a sports bra or camisole which I tried but I am larger too 36D and I just can't see me going bra less. I am going to ask about the taping thing. Were any of you told to air out your rad. after a treatment? I have heard this from others. I am beginning to think we aren't meant to start this with all the delays. I guess it will eventually! I am supposed to go back to work Jan 5 and I sure hope I am not too tired after treatments. the running down to the hospital every day is bad enough but then I will have to go to work after it. Carolyn

My med onc told me it could be like this for a couple of years. Yeah great! Why didn't they tell me? If I get any helpful info I will let ya'll know. Carolyn
Posts.Title: Soreness in radiation site 6 mos later bennetts1 bennetts1

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2008 05:52AM gramma23 wrote: Laura, I too am sorry about your problem. My arm did tingle and feel like it was alseep for a short period of time but if I rubbed it lightly it would go away. It burns now and again I will rub it very lightly and it helps. My arm feels like it is sun burned all the time. I can't say anything about you taking meds since I have taken meds for years to control my fibromyalgia. If you need the meds take them, I do not believe in this driving you crazy. You will have to watch though not to take more than is prescribed. If you can keep the meds to the amount your doc reccomends then take then until you can do without them. This is my opinion some may have different thoughts on the matter. gramma23

I feel so bad for her and almost quilty because I had a lumpectomy with lymphs removed but so far no port. I go today to see what I will take. I hope to go back to work. My doc said my was gone but then who really knows. I am hoping for the best with everyone.

Posts.Title: leaving for another pet scan jerseymaria LumiPojo

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2008 10:03AM gramma23 wrote: Is your leg hot where it is swollen? You do need to see the doc and keep your leg up until you do. DO NOT rub it at all. I have leg problems too but so far no blood clots just edema from previous surgery for hysterectomy with endrometrosis. A clot is very serious so please see doc as soon as possibly or if you think it is a clot and can't get in to see doc go to emergency ASAP. Wishing you the best! let us here from you as to what you find out. It could be a muscle spasm but it is best to be sure. Carolyn

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2008 06:18AM gramma23 wrote: Call the doc that put it in as soon as possible. Have you had a treatment through it yet? Carolyn

Posts.Content: gramma23 wrote: I had surgery Monday and I am doing fine from that but Tuesday I will be going to see what is next. they had to take all my lymph nodes out under the leftÂ arm and did the lumpectomy. The doc told my husband I would need chemo and radiation. Before the surgery they thought just radiation and so I am disappointed but of course I want to do what ever to keep it from coming back. I am hoping I don't get too sick. I know my husband and family want to help out but I do not like to have to have people wait on me. I know I am too independent but I have to stay busy. I am also not sure when I will go back to work. I am on my vacation right now and since I have the appointment on Tuesday I guess I will have to use some more of it until I am released to go back to work. I have a lot of questions so I guess I will just wait and I guess they will have the pathology by then too. It is hard to wait! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I am wondering what I will take gramma23 gramma23

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2008 08:27AM gramma23 wrote: Thanks collector. I do lean on my husband for a lot but I have had fibromyalgia for 20 something years and so I do take anti anxiety meds and pain meds. the doc thought I would need more than normal but so far I am just taking what I normally take. the 2 nights I took the heavy duty pain meds I slept for just a few hours and would be awake the rest of the night or rather early morning with everyone else asleep. I took what I normally take for fibro last night and I slept like a rock and had a hard time waking up. I feel much better not taking that hard stuff. I am not really nervous just hate waiting for the decision of what I need to take for the cancer.
Posts.Title: I am wondering what I will take gramma23 gramma23

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2009 07:28AM gramma23 wrote: I finished rad March 4, 2009 and my surgery breast is hard underneath and much firmer and bigger than the other. I will be 62 in Aug so that means time has taken a toll on my body but after my first mammogram my surgery breast got harder and more painful. I do not like it! I can live with the sagging but the difference in size between the left breast and right is not easy to deal with since I need a different cup size for the swollen one and will have to pad the other one. the rad onc told me the hardness of the rad breast would go away but I am wondering when. I go back to him in Oct. so I guess we will see. My chemo onc thinks it is normal or at least does not make any suggestions since I have other problems to worry about. I am glad to know I am not the only one dealing with this. I doubt the insurance will pay anything on getting the breast resized. If not then I am out of luck. I just want the pain to go away.

I do dread the port but I like the doc who is putting it in, He did my surgery. I am stage 3. I do not know the lingo yet but I am sure I will learn. I am going to a class on Thursday to prepare me for this. My friend I go to church with has already started hers and had a problem with her first port so I am dreading this problem. I guess I will leave this up to God. Carolyn
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in July 08? slortiz slortiz

Posts.Content: gramma23 wrote: I am not scared but just want to get it over. I am mad becauseÂ I want to do so much this summer and I am afraid I will not feel like it. I am having a lumpectomy and one lymph node is enlarged and the doc says he is sure it has cancer too. I found this in Dec. but I have had lumps for years because of fibrocystic disease so I thought cut down on caffene since durning Christmas I was going crazy with chocolate and coffee. I am hoping the lymph node does not show cancer because if it does then he will take out the lymph nodes in my left arm. I know all you have the same problems but I do wish I had had this done earlier and maybe the lymph node would be okay. Should have, could have, would have. How many times will I have to say that? I am turning 61 in Aug. you would think I would know better but then it was not there in Nov and then it was there in Dec. gramma23 Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: newly freaked out anniemcelfresh Dukemom2

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 11:14AM gramma23 wrote: TDF, I had horrible back pain and bone pain when I had to take Neulasta. I took it after every chemo like you but I had back problems before I had cancer. I have arthritis so I really don't think mine is related to the Neulasta just it got worse after the shot. Chemo did a number on me anyway. I am still trying to get my red blood count up and this was in July 2008. I hope you get to feeling better but the only way I would know for you to get much info is to write to the FDA about your side effects from it. They are interested in side effects from people on drugs.
Posts.Title: Correlation between Neulasta pain & Back/Spinal Disease? TDF gramma23

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2008 06:30AM gramma23 wrote: I think that is one thing that is most likely. I had acid problems and the onc gave me Protonix and pepcid for backup. I got nausea meds too. Just ask for something to help you. I have always had stomach problems even before bc. Carolyn
Posts.Title: Anyone had stomach problems with Chemo? BlueMama gramma23

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2008 01:46PM gramma23 wrote: I recommend asking the doc for a script for Protoxin. Works wonders! then if that is not enough you can get Pepcid in script which is 2x as strong as over the counter. Heartburn was my biggest problem at first. Carolyn
Posts.Title: Heartburn Deedee79 Sable

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2008 08:38AM gramma23 wrote: I am glad you spoke up and you are right that steriods keep a person awake. I take them for arthritis and I am always happy once they quit keeping me awake but then unfortunately they stop helping the pain about that time too. You just keep on standing up for yourself because you are the one that knows your body.
Posts.Title: I had a meltdown at chemo today... tooyoungtohavebc Rovergirl

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2010 08:49AM gramma23 wrote: I had Neulasta every time the day after chemo except the first one. They tried Neupogen but it is not as strong and you usually have to take several. Some give it to themselves but it did not bring my count up and I guess mine dropped fast. You must keep your white blood counts up or you will end up in the hospital. I am 2 years post and having to take shots for red blood cells. The chemo really did a number on me. I was Er-/Pr- but Her +. If your onc is not talking to you I would insist on another onc. This is your life you are dealing with not theirs. I had 4 nodes positive and they took out 22 from the mass. My sentinel node was as big as the original tumor and then the nodes from that had cancer. I do not understand how they grade this for sure because right after surgery I was stage III and after surgery my rad onc said stage IIb. Is that because they took most of the cancer out. I had had a lot of questions since I finished but no one wants to answer them now. I think it is because they don't know what will happen they just know what can happen.I feel another lump but the onc can't feel it or they say it is scar tissue. I get frustrated so I have to be on my toes.I will have another mammogram in Jan and I am going to insist on an ultra sound in this area. I did not fight this stuff to let it get away from me now. I think you have to be the one who keeps up on this because the onc are so busy. Don't let them push you around and make sure what your counts are every time. It is your life and your responsibility. I did not have little children but I know if I did I would be that much more on top of things. I wish all of you the best. Carolyn
Posts.Title: Is Neulasta Helpful? TonLee TonLee

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2008 03:15PM gramma23 wrote: I take 8 mg at night before tx, 8mg morning of tx and then 8 mg the next day. It makes me feel better becauseÂ I take steroids for my arthritis and instead of making my feet swell and keep me awayÂ I sleep better and it reduces the swelling in my joints.Â I was not able to take my tx Wed but had taken the steroids and he said next time to take them at night and bring them the next morning just in case I could not take it again. My platelets are too low. Carolyn
